snippet: At a time when everyone wants information for free, Angie’s List, which features user-generated reviews of services, charges for access. Yet something about its business model is working.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column on Angie's List, Web site that allows users to search for reviews of useful services in their area and to contribute their own evaluations; notes that unlike its competitor Yelp, Angie's List does not allow anonymous reviews, and requires paid subscriptions; says that despite unusual business model, subscription rates have risen in recent years.
lead_paragraph: At a time when everyone wants information for free, Angie’s List, which features user-generated reviews of services, charges for access. Yet something about its business model is working.

headline.print_headline: At Angie’s List, the Reviews Are Real (So Is Angie)
headline.seo: At Angie’s List, the Reviews Are Real (So Is Angie)
headline.main: At Angie’s List, the Reviews Are Real (So Is Angie)
